greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of eta(q)^4 * eta(q^2) * eta(q^6)^5 / eta(q^3)^4 in powers of q.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
Cubic AGM theta functions: a(q) (see A004016), b(q) (A005928), c(q) (A005882).
reference: B. C. Berndt, Ramanujan's Notebooks Part III, Springer-Verlag, see p. 226 Entry 4(i).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q * psi(q)^2 * phi(-q)^3 * psi(q^3)^2 / phi(-q^3) in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 01 2011
Expansion of (b(q^2)^3 - b(q)^3) / 9 in powers of q where b() is a cubic AGM theta function. - _Michael Somos_, Mar 01 2011
Expansion of (1/3) * b(q) * b(q^2) * c(q^2)^2 / c(q) in powers of q where b(), c() are cubic AGM theta functions. - _Michael Somos_, Jul 09 2012

a(n) is multiplicative with a(2^e) = (-4)^e, a(3^e) = 1, a(p^e) = ((p^2)^(e+1) - 1) / (p^2 - 1) if p == 1 (mod 6), a(p^e) = (1 - (-p^2)^(e+1)) / (p^2 + 1) if p == 5 (mod 6). - _Michael Somos_, Mar 01 2011
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (6 t)) = 243^(1/2) (t/i)^3 g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A214262.
mathematica: a[ n_]:= If[ n < 1, 0, Sum[ Mod[ n/d, 2] d^2 KroneckerSymbol[d, 3], {d, Divisors[n]}]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jul 09 2012 *)
eta[q_]:= q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; CoefficientList[Series[eta[q]^4* eta[q^2]*eta[q^6]^5/eta[q^3]^4, {q, 0, 30}], q] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 18 2018 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv( n, d, (n/d%2) * d^2 * kronecker(d,3)) )};
(PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A)^4 * eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^6 + A)^5 / eta(x^3 + A)^4, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Aug 08 2005
